author: LMG Clips
description:
Thanks to our LMG clips sponsors dbrand, Dell, and Secretlab. You can check them out at the links below:

dbrand: https://dbrand.com/pcb
Dell: https://lmg.gg/dellprowanclips
Secretlab: https://lmg.gg/secretlablmgclips

OpenAI is reviving GPT-4o after user backlash, but only behind a $20/month subscription. The move has highlighted just how many people rely on AI companions, raising bigger questions about emotional dependency, the normalization of digital relationships, and whether AI can cross into manipulative or even abusive behaviour. Linus and Luke discuss what this means for the future of human-AI interaction.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WOQJkS8l2sk

► GET EXCLUSIVE CONTENT ON FLOATPLANE: https://lmg.gg/lttfloatplane

title: What Happens When Your AI Girlfriend Gets Paywalled?

author: LMG Clips

Dell: https://lmg.gg/dellprowanclips
Secretlab: https://lmg.gg/secretlablmgclips

Checkout Basically Homeless’s video here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9alJwQG-Wbk

Linus and Luke discuss  Basically Homeless’s experiment with a real-life aimbot, using muscle stimulation and machine vision to automatically guide his arm for near-instant aim in CS2. The project blurs the line between accessibility tech and outright cheating in competitive gaming.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WOQJkS8l2sk

title: He Built a Real Life Aimbot

Linus and Luke discuss how Steam lost PayPal payment options in many regions after Mastercard and Visa pressure over NSFW content. They debate whether financial institutions should have the power to control what we can spend our money on, and what this means for gamers.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WOQJkS8l2sk

title: Credit Cards Are Controlling What You Can Buy on Steam
